Each time it receives a message on each input port, it sends one message consisting of the stamp of the message received on in0 and the concatenation of the date received on in0, in1, ... inNb-1
A routing node is a simple component. It just takes messages on 'in' port and sends them on 'out' port.

Every time it receives a message on endIt port, it looks for the most recent message received on stamps port and sends to order port the stamp of this message. Used for implementing greedy (subsampling) filtering.
Each time it receives a message on its 'order' port, it forwards the message received on 'in' port to 'out' port according to the (optional) stamp and scratch parameters
Add nb inital messages, then forward incoming message to output (used to boot cycles)
